## hello world

## digital garden

* This garden is the public section of my Obsidian vault and is always in progress, tagged based on the state my thoughts are in the current note. Majority of these notes are going to be atomic.
* This garden is more of a notebook than a blog, because I've been pulled down the PKM rabbit hole, too.

### credits

[stealing from my heroes](https://joschuasgarden.com/30+External/31+Books/Steal+Like+an+Artist+%E2%80%93+10+Things+Nobody+Told+You+About+Being+Creative) | this digital garden is made possible with [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/), [Quartz](https://github.com/jackyzha0/quartz), and this awesome [blog](https://brandonkboswell.com/blog/Publishing-your-Obsidian-Vault-Online-with-Quartz/).

/about.title: about
/about.content:
---

## Hi, I'm Jane

I'm a tech enthusiast and a cat mom of four. Professionally, I work in IT, but I enjoy tech in general.

I tend to get lost in the rabbit hole of *attempting* to build my second brain using [Obsidian](https://obsidian.md/) and [Notion](https://www.notion.so/). The intent of this site is to become my [digital garden](https://janeilagan.github.io/digital-garden) and not a formal blog. It's less focused on polishing what I put here, so if you see any dead links, those are probably ideas not cultivated yet, or they link to my private notes inside my vault. 

There is no defined topic as to what I'll be publishing here, ranging from cringe-y notes I wrote when I was younger, to tech notes, or random weird *things*.

 > 
 > Learn to live alongside cringe. No matter how hard you try to avoid being cringe, you will look back on your life and cringe retrospectively. Cringe is unavoidable over a lifetime. Even the term ‘cringe’ might someday be deemed ‘cringe’.
 > 
 > -Taylor Swift, NYU speech

/bud.content:
## I'm still deciding

These are early stages of notes, still deciding whether I need more [seed](seed.md)s or it can grow on it's own as a [shrub](shrub.md). Or [a tree maybe](a%20tree%20maybe.md).

Here's to hoping it won't get [wilted](wilted.md).

/seed.title: seed
/seed.content:
## I can be a surprise

These are ideas probably picked from somewhere, or randomly thought of in the middle of doing something else. It can be from a book, a blog, a video or any material which caught my attention, or a random idea made up in my head.  Ideas I want to cultivate more to become a [bud](bud.md). Or it could get [wilted](wilted.md), lol.

/shrub.title: shrub
/shrub.content:
## I'm watering the plants!

Let them grow! It could be an idea's peak potential, or it can even be [a tree maybe](a%20tree%20maybe.md).
